Package com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.tcptest

Class TcpHandlers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.tcptest.TcpHandlers
  • public abstract class TcpHandlers
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory methods for standard TcpHandler implementations.
    Since:
    1.3.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static TcpHandler forwardToPort​(int forwardToPort)
      Creates an implementation of TcpHandler that, for each incoming request, opens a socket connection to the specified port and then forwards all traffic from the incoming request to that socket, and vice versa.
      static TcpHandler noResponse()
      Returns an implementation of TcpHandler that immediately exits, so that TcpServer will close the socket with no response.
      static TcpHandler sequential​(TcpHandler... handlers)
      Creates a stateful TcpHandler that delegates to each of the specified handlers in sequence as each request is received.
      static TcpHandler writeData​(byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Creates an implementation of TcpHandler that writes some data to the socket.
      static TcpHandler writeString​(java.lang.String s)
      Creates an implementation of TcpHandler that writes a UTF-8 string to the socket.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • writeData

        public static TcpHandler writeData​(byte[] data,
                                   int offset,
                                   int length)
        Creates an implementation of TcpHandler that writes some data to the socket.
        Parameters:
        data - the data buffer
        offset - the starting offset
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Returns:
        a handler

      • writeString

        public static TcpHandler writeString​(java.lang.String s)
        Creates an implementation of TcpHandler that writes a UTF-8 string to the socket.
        Parameters:
        s - the string
        Returns:
        a handler

      • forwardToPort

        public static TcpHandler forwardToPort​(int forwardToPort)
        Creates an implementation of TcpHandler that, for each incoming request, opens a socket connection to the specified port and then forwards all traffic from the incoming request to that socket, and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        forwardToPort - the port to forward to
        Returns:
        a handler

      • noResponse

        public static TcpHandler noResponse()
        Returns an implementation of TcpHandler that immediately exits, so that TcpServer will close the socket with no response.

        A typical use case would be to simulate an I/O error when testing client code that is making HTTP requests; if the (simulated) HTTP server closes the socket without writing a response, clients will treat this as a broken connection error.

        Returns:
        a handler

      • sequential

        public static TcpHandler sequential​(TcpHandler... handlers)
        Creates a stateful TcpHandler that delegates to each of the specified handlers in sequence as each request is received.
        Parameters:
        handlers - a sequence of handlers
        Returns:
        a handler
